text: Thomes Bruce 'Tom' Peters (1895-1960) was an Australian rugby league footballer and pioneer player for St. George in the 1920s Peters was a forward at St. George during the club's early years.Whiticker/Hudson "The Encyclopedia of Rugby League Players" 1995 Edition He played between 1923-26 and later became a selector for the club in the late 1920s. Peters was also a veteran on the first world war (14th Field Company Engineers). AIF Project Thomas Bruce Peters https://www.aif.adfa.edu.au/showPerson?pid=239384 Peters died on 21 September 1960 at his Coogee, New South Wales home. Sydney Morning Herald- Death Notice: 22 Sept 1960 (Page 32) ==References== Category:St. George Dragons players Category:1895 births Category:1960 deaths Category:Australian rugby league administrators Category:Australian rugby league players Category:Australian military personnel of World War I Category:Rugby league props Category:Rugby league second-rows Category:Rugby league players from Sydney
title: Tom Peters (rugby league)
